metadata.Title: CVE-2018-7453 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - negligible.
metadata.Description:
Infinite recursion in AcroForm::scanField in AcroForm.cc in xpdf 4.00 allows attackers to launch denial of service via a specific pdf file due to lack of loop checking, as demonstrated by pdftohtml.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-7453` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-poppler-0.18 - 0.24.5-2ubuntu4.9
libpoppler-cpp0 - 0.24.5-2ubuntu4.9
libpoppler-glib8 - 0.24.5-2ubuntu4.9
libpoppler-qt4-4 - 0.24.5-2ubuntu4.9
libpoppler-qt5-1 - 0.24.5-2ubuntu4.9
libpoppler44 - 0.24.5-2ubuntu4.9
poppler-utils - 0.24.5-2ubuntu4.9
No subscription required

notes.Note: jdstrand> xpdf in koffice is 2.0 mdeslaur> code isn't in poppler

criterions.comment: ipe: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
libextractor: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
poppler package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.24.5-2ubuntu4.9').
xpdf: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
